sentences: Richard Arnold "Groove" Holmes  (May 2, 1931 – June 29, 1991) was an American jazz organist who performed in the hard bop and soul jazz genre.
He is best known for his 1965 recording of "Misty".
Holmes's first album, on Pacific Jazz with guest Ben Webster, was recorded in March 1961.
He recorded many albums for Pacific Jazz, Prestige, Groove Merchant, and Muse, many of them with Houston Person.
He died of a heart attack after battling prostate cancer, having performed his last concerts in a wheelchair.
One of his last gigs was at the 1991 Chicago Blues Festival with his longtime friend, singer Jimmy Witherspoon.
